posts.post_content: I'm really hoping that this is going to be reprinted in M14. It's the fun counterspell, I prefer this so much to just denying/permission, and I like that it doesn't force you to target any particular type of spell (you can even cast it targeting a creature spell to activate Guttersnipe/Talrand/Nivix Cyclops/Fluxcharger etc.) since that gives it a nice place in my spellslinger Izzet deck.

posts.post_content: Often a 2-for-1 when used on a removal spell, and can fight counterspell wars. Also can answer uncounterable removal spells like [Abrupt Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abrupt Decay) and [Combust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Combust). As a bonus, it even gets around hexproof when used on an opponent's removal spell. Highly underrated card.

Posted By: SirLibraryEater (12/28/2013 9:49:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card seems amazing at first, and it is when it works. Once I started playing it, I realized that it has some serious limitations. It can't stop [Essence Scatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Scatter) under most circumstances, nor can it stop spells when there are no other legal targets, which happens a lot against artifact and enchantment removal spells, nor abilities like [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring).  
  
On the plus side you can 2 for 1 your opponent, steal an aura, target their hexproof creature.  
  
It can be very satisfying to use, and if you opponent complains, tell them they just got taste of their own medicine.
posts.html:
This card seems amazing at first, and it is when it works. Once I started playing it, I realized that it has some serious limitations. It can't stop Essence Scatter under most circumstances, nor can it stop spells when there are no other legal targets, which happens a lot against artifact and enchantment removal spells, nor abilities like Oblivion Ring.

On the plus side you can 2 for 1 your opponent, steal an aura, target their hexproof creature.

It can be very satisfying to use, and if you opponent complains, tell them they just got taste of their own medicine.
